content: Hi everyone! My name's Ayrton and I'm relatively new here. I wanted to help improve rust since I've found it so useful in my personal projects (mostly emulators and a JIT compiler). So far I've only worked on a couple of diagnostics issues, but I think I'd like to get more involved with constant evaluation stuff. It'd be great if I could get some pointers on how I could help.
Hi @Ayrton Muñoz! You may want to read the Constant evaluation section of the rustc dev guide.
I'd love to hear more about the JIT compiler project that you're working on.

Josh Triplett said:

I'd love to hear more about the JIT compiler project that you're working on.

It's just a barebones recompiler to turn MIPS I instructions into x86-64 machine code. I originally made it for my PS1 emulator, but it's generic enough to work with other MIPS I console emulators. It's definitely a WIP though since I have some bugs in my register allocator.
